data.title: DJ Khaled: How He Rose To Fame And His Best Advice To You
data.meta_description: DJ Khaled, a music-industry mogul, an executive, a mega producer, and a recording artist, shares how he decides who to work with, how his heritage has impacted his career choices, best advice and more.
data.text:
I spoke with DJ Khaled, a music-industry mogul, an executive, a mega producer, and a recording artist, about how he decides who to work with, how his heritage has impacted his career choices, his use of SnapChat, how he deals with negative people, his daily routine, best advice and more. DJ Khaled's latest book is called The Keys and it's available in bookstores everywhere this month.

He is the founder of the We The Best Music Group, he is also the creator of one of the most globally viewed Snapchat accounts.DJ Khaled was a radio host for the Miami-based urban music radio station WEDR and the DJ for the hip hop group Terror Squad. From 2004 to 2006, Khaled assisted in the production of the hip-hop albums Real Talk by Fabolous, True Story by Terror Squad, All or Nothing by Fat Joe, and Me, Myself, & I by Fat Joe. In 2009, Khaled became the president of record label Def Jam South and he is also the CEO and founder of We the Best Music Group. This summer, he released his 9th studio album called Major Key and national ambassador for Get Schooled.

Watch on Forbes:

Dan Schawbel: How has your upbringing in Florida, and your Palestinian heritage, impacted your life and career choices?

DJ Khaled: I am just grateful for being raised by a beautiful mother and father who are still married for so many years, who taught me to be a good person.

Schawbel: Throughout your career you have aligned yourself with some of the best artists in the world, How do you select which artists to work with and which to avoid?

DJ Khaled: Man I just work with good people that I like making good music with, each record I just go with the vibe but aside from the vibe of the music I have to make sure I vibe with the person.

Schawbel: Why did you start using Snapchat, how have you used it and why do you think you were able to gain popularity on the platform when others haven't?

DJ Khaled: I am just being me, being great and this was the perfect platform for people to see me and my own essence.

Schawbel: Who would you say has most influenced your music, your career and your life?

DJ Khaled: Too many people to name. Here are a few, Jay Z, Puff Daddy, Michael Jackson, Bob Marley, Stevie Wonder and Quincy Jones and Barry Gordy both Barry and Quincy who innovated a genre of music like me.

Schawbel: What did you learn from Puff Daddy that helped you become a better artist?'

DJ Khaled: You know what it is 'can't stop won't stop.'

Schawbel: What was one challenge you encountered at the beginning of your career and how did you overcome it?

DJ Khaled: One challenge I encountered early in my career was to finance my own vision ...I overcame by never giving up.

Schawbel: Can you share our morning routine and how it helps you prepare for your day?

DJ Khaled: My morning routine is to pray...I pray every morning it's the best preparation ever.

Schawbel: What are some of your future goals and how do you plan on accomplishing them?

DJ Khaled: My future goals are to continue to work hard and smart and staying focused on the pathway of more success more blessings more wins more life.

Schawbel: How do you avoid people who try to bring you down?

DJ Khaled: Never entertain 'they' keep 'they' away from you the key is to stay away from 'they.'

Schawbel: What are your top three pieces of career advice?
